content.question: The transportation development described in the excerpt had which of the following effects on agriculture in the United States?

choices.label: Railroad workers replaced farmers as the largest group of workers in the United States.
Food prices rose as a result of increased demand for grain from coastal port cities.
Farmers developed cooperative organizations to limit the power of rail companies.
Rural immigrant populations outpaced those of cities as access to land became easier.

content.answer: Farmers developed cooperative organizations to limit the power of rail companies.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
